messages.didYouKnowMessage:
There is an area of the Pacific Ocean three times the size of France which contains
80 000 tonnes
of plastic rubbish.
<style=DYK>359 million tonnes</style> of plastic were produced in 2018 (Almost <style=DYK>50 kg</style> of plastic for every person on the Planet).

Only 2% of the world's plastic is recycled into similar products.
8% is recycled to make lower-value plastics. The rest is burned, put in landfill, or leaks into the environment.
In 2014, <style=DYK>6%</style> of the world's oil consumption was used for making plastics.
In 2015 it was estimated that <style=DYK>12.7 million</style> pieces of plastics entered the ocean every year.
<style=DYK>40%</style> of plastic is produced for packaging and is only used once before being disposed of.
